title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 14 December 2015 - XWiki
content:

10:34 <vmassol> good morning every one  
10:34 <vmassol> hope you had a good week end!  
10:34 <vmassol> :)  
10:48 <Inge-> :)

10:59 <tmortagne> vmassol, mflorea: you both have a few closed issues without documentation  
11:01 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
11:02 <mflorea> tmortagne: finishing with http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-3622 and I'll work on documentation  
11:02 <tmortagne> ok  
11:03 <vmassol> tmortagne: yep, thanks  
11:18 <Pbas> Hello, I try to use this realtime Extension http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/RtWysiwyg without success.  
11:18 <Pbas> Documentation refer to http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/WebSocket but websocket parameter in xwiki.properties missing :-(  
11:19 <vmassol> cjd: that's a question for you! :)  
11:19 <vmassol> hi Pbas  
11:19 <Pbas> Hi :-)  
11:23 <tmortagne> Pbas: I can't tell you much about this extension but websocket.\* properties are definitely not standard properties so you should add them when you need them yes  
11:24 <Pbas> Ok I will give a try then  
11:29 \* cjd runs  
11:29 <cjd> what's up ?  
11:29 <cjd> interested in popular extensions ?   :)  
11:29 <ansuz> has quit  
11:29 <Pbas> :-) hello yes  
11:30 <Pbas> I didn't manage to use your nice extension  
11:30 <Pbas> RtWysiwyg  
11:30 <cjd> Oh, try to avoid it for the moment, it is quite buggy :(  
11:31 <Pbas> ho it's shame but is it the same for Plain WikiText Editor ?  
11:32 <cjd> Plain WikiText is quite stable  
11:32 <cjd> thanks to issues we discovered in production, we're working on making it even better but at this point I feel good about recommending you use it.  
11:33 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
11:33 <Pbas> Ok but it is buggy too but i don't know if it coming from a conflict between two extension  
11:35 <Pbas> I'm on https, I must add websocket paramete in xwiki.properties?  
11:35 <Pbas> \* parameters  
11:45 <cjd> Oh the websocket parameters, sorry I didn't read the backlog  
11:45 <Pbas> An example, if I edit a page I haven't "allow realtim collaboration" (with RtWysiwyg I had it)  
11:45 <cjd> since it's an extension, you need to add them  
11:45 <Pbas> I didn't have "join realtime" either  
11:46 <cjd> right, that means the websocket is not setup  
11:46 <cjd> are you on HTTPS ?  
11:46 <Pbas> yes  
11:46 <cjd> ok, you need to follow all of the instructions on the Websocket extension page  
11:46 <Pbas> ok thxs  
11:46 <cjd> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/WebSocket  
11:52 <cjd> has quit  
12:03 <ansuz> has joined #xwiki  
12:07 <Ramona1> has quit  
12:08 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
12:08 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
12:08 <Sputnikk23> has joined #xwiki  
12:08 <Sputnikk23> Hi all  
12:09 <Sputnikk23> My XWiki installation doesn't hold extensions across restarts. All other settings do. I'm only using the LDAP extension and install it using the web interface. I get it configured and working properly. Restart/reboot, the settings stay but the extension says not installed. Any ideas on a solution?  
12:16 <cjd> I'm not sure but perhaps make sure your Permanent Directory (as configured in the xwiki.properties file) is not inside of a temp directory that is cleaned on startup.  
12:20 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
12:22 <Sputnikk23> cjd: xwiki.conf you mean?  
12:22 <cjd> it might be inside of xwiki.cfg  
12:23 <cjd> I don't remember properly  
12:23 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:23 <Sputnikk23> environment.permanentDirectory?  
12:23 <Sputnikk23> how can I check it's current value?  
12:24 <Sputnikk23> (running value)  
12:24 <cjd> yup, that's the one, if nothing is set then it will use a directory inside of where xwiki is deployed  
12:24 <cjd> so it depends on how you installed  
12:25 <Sputnikk23> manual war + jetty in /opt/jetty/webapps/xwiki  
12:25 <Sputnikk23> reverse proxy through apache  
12:27 <cjd> does XWiki have write access on /opt/jetty/webapps/xwiki ?  
12:32 <Sputnikk23> yes  
12:32 <Sputnikk23> permanent directory was commented out, with /var/local/xwiki which didn't exist  
12:33 <Sputnikk23> not sure what it was defaulting to. just uncommented. waiting for jetty to restart to test  
12:36 <cjd> uhh that's going to have side-effects  
12:36 <cjd> well it seems that wherever it put your permanent dir was somewhere that was getting wiped each time anyway so maybe no problem  
12:37 <cjd> make sure that the user which tomcat is running under has write permission on /var/local/xwiki  
12:37 <Sputnikk23> jetty but yeah. xwiki isn't loading now. be back to report in a sec  
12:37 <Sputnikk23> thank you for your help  
12:38 <cjd> oh right indeed, jetty  
12:38 <cjd> IMO jetty is a better container than tomcat but that's just my personal opinion  
12:38 <Sputnikk23> seems easier to setup. lol  
12:38 <Sputnikk23> javax.servlet.UnavailableException: Cannot initialize RequestProcessor of class com.xpn.xwiki.web.XWikiRequestProcessor: java.lang.NullPointerException         at org.apache.struts.action.ActionServlet.getRequestProcessor(ActionServlet.java:614)  
12:38 <Sputnikk23> is what i get hitting jetty directly  
12:39 <cjd> can you paste the entire stack trace to https://ncry.pt/ and put the link here ?  
12:39 <Sputnikk23> sure. uno momento good sire  
12:45 <Sputnikk23> ok so it's looking for stuff in /var/local/xwiki that's non existant. i did a find for it and it exists under /tmp/jetty-0.0.0.0-8080-xwiki\*garbage\*.dir  
12:45 <Sputnikk23> there's also one for META-INF, resources, skins,templates and WEB-Inf  
12:46 <Sputnikk23> do i have to move any of that stuff to /var/local/xwiki ?  
12:46 <cjd> just create the directory and give jetty permissions on it  
12:46 <Sputnikk23> or can i \*start fresh\* so to speak, my mods/changes should be in the DB?  
12:46 <cjd> some of them will be, extensions will not be  
12:46 <Sputnikk23> ok let me try that because it did also bitch about perms which i thought i gave  
12:46 <cjd> but that's your problem already  
12:47 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: you're back today? :)  
12:47 <vmassol> welcome back!  
12:47 <gdelhumeau> Hello vmassol  
12:47 <gdelhumeau> Yes  
12:47 <gdelhumeau> Thanks :)  
12:47 <vmassol> just in time for the doing the 7.4M2 release, nice timing :)  
12:47 <vmassol> nah I'm kidding Thomas is handling it for you  
12:48 <gdelhumeau> :)  
12:48 <vmassol> (I did yours for 7.4M1 and thomas is doing 7.4M2)  
12:48 <gdelhumeau> then I'll do 7.4RC1  
12:48 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: will you be there?  
12:49 <vmassol> it's planned for the 21st of Dec  
12:49 <vmassol> (ie next Monday)  
12:49 <gdelhumeau> Yes I'll be there  
12:49 <vmassol> ok great  
13:26 <Sputnikk23> cjd: looks like that worked. thank you  
13:26 <cjd> sure thing  
13:59 <vmassol> hmmm superadmin seems to not be able to view hidden pages  
13:59 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
14:00 <vmassol> (it can navigate to hidden pages but it doesn't seem them listed and there's no way to configure it)  
14:00 <vmassol> I'm having a problem in a func tests where I use the superadmin user and I have hidden pages ;)  
14:02 <tmortagne> vmassol: yes the default is hidden unless told otherwise in the conf I guess  
14:02 <vmassol> what conf?  
14:02 <vmassol> there's no profile for superadmin  
14:02 <tmortagne> user conf, the profile  
14:02 <tmortagne> yes exactly :)  
14:02 <vmassol> so we have an issue here  
14:02 <tmortagne> so it's hidden since there is no conf  
14:02 <vmassol> yes  
14:03 <msmeria> has quit  
14:04 <ClemensR> side note: when I register at http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/  I am told to make "all modifications you want" in the sandbox, but I have no edit rights there  
14:06 <vmassol> ah yes  
14:06 <vmassol> we need to resave the mysql dump, I thought I did it but I must have forgotten  
14:07 <vmassol> fixed for 24 hours....  
14:11 <tmortagne> guys could you move to 7.4RC1 things you known won't go in 7.4M2  
14:12 <tmortagne> vmassol, mflorea, gdelhumeau, Enygma`  
14:15 <vmassol> note that sdumitriu has commits for http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12891 but he hasn't closed it  
14:16 <vmassol> tmortagne: I don't see any issue opened for me in 7.4M2  
14:17 <tmortagne> in case you have idea for the unassignes ones  
14:17 <tmortagne> \*unassigned  
14:17 <vmassol> k  
14:18 <ClemensR> confirmation: can edit playground sandbox now :)  
14:19 <Enygma`> tmortagne: done on my side  
14:19 <Enygma`> on http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12775 I`m waiting to stabilize all the tests until closing it.  
14:20 <tmortagne> Enygma`: ok thanks  
14:31 <vmassol> hmm seems livetable's 'queryFilters': 'hidden' doesn't work in 6.4 for some reason… strange because http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9339 is closed in 6.0M1  
14:31 <vmassol> any idea?  
14:32 <vmassol> hmm I see http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8973 is open, strange  
14:33 <vmassol> ah reopened by anca… hmm  
14:33 <vmassol> ah no it's closed  
14:33 <vmassol> :)  
14:33 <vmassol> so it should work  
14:33 <sdumitriu> vmassol: Any idea where/if XWIKI-12891 should be documented?  
14:35 <vmassol> sdumitriu: this is a bug fix, should be N/A IMO  
14:35 <vmassol> however you have other issues that require docs  
14:35 <vmassol> for 7.4M1  
14:35 <vmassol> see http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12867?jql=Project%20in%20(%22XWiki%20Commons%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Rendering%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Platform%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Enterprise%22)%20and%20fixVersion%20in%20(%227.4-milestone-1%22)%20and%20resolution%20in%20(%22Fixed%22)%20and%20((Documentation%20is%20EMPTY)%20or%20(%22Documentation%20in%20Release%20Notes%22%20is%20EMPTY))  
14:35 <vmassol> bad link  
14:35 <vmassol> this one: https://jira.xwiki.org/issues/?jql=Project%20in%20(%22XWiki%20Commons%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Rendering%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Platform%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Enterprise%22)%20and%20fixVersion%20in%20(%227.4-milestone-1%22)%20and%20resolution%20in%20(%22Fixed%22)%20and%20((Documentation%20is%20EMPTY)%20or%20(%22Documentation%20in%20Release%20Notes%22%20is%20EMPTY))  
14:35 <vmassol> (sdumitriu)  
14:54 <vmassol> "Refactor the refactoring module to be able to write unit tests more easily. " nice :)  
14:55 <cjd> If Cyril Northcote Parkinson were alive today, he would be proud  
15:29 <cjd> vmassol: Idea: suppose we used a sort of CI to do releases of extensions, so basically you register an extension (repository) to be released and then you push a tag and when it detects a tag has been pushed, it does the release in-house ?  
15:31 <tmortagne> cjd: if it's a Maven project the release plugin does a bit more than creating a tag, it also set the right version before and update to next version SNAPSHOT after  
15:32 <tmortagne> two thing that may be a pain to do by hand when you have several modules  
15:33 <tmortagne> if what bother you is Nexus validation I actually found out that there is a nexus release plugin that can automatically validate the release, just did not had time to setup that in https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/parent  
15:35 <cjd> what bothers me is mostly that I have to teach each person in my team about maven and then the flag to not require java6 and then they always have some problem with GPG and then if they're on windows (Yann is) there is another problem  
15:36 <cjd> What we could do is weed the version number out of the tag name and then fix it in all of the POMs before releasing and then garbage any of the tags created by maven release plugin  
15:36 <cjd> if there's no obvious version number in the tag name or if anything else goes wrong, put the error in the page of the extension on e.x.o  
15:37 <cjd> this would make releasing an extension something that someone could do without this 1 hour training which seems to currently be mandatory  
15:37 <tmortagne> you are talking about making more painful each release so that the first one require a bit less documentation  
15:38 <cjd> It's not just documentation, people don't expect things to require a page of documentation  
15:38 <cjd> if they do, people just leave  
15:38 <cjd> if you ever released something on npm, you know what we're up against  
15:48 <mflorea> vmassol: see my comment on XWIKI-12908  
15:56 <msmeria1> has quit  
16:51 <vmassol> mflorea: thanks for your comment  
17:08 <vmassol> mflorea: latest feedback could be interesting for you to have in mind: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/DownloadFormFeedback ;)  
17:09 <mflorea> indeed, that would be nice  
17:09 <vmassol> yup  
17:10 <vmassol> solr 5.4.0 released btw  
17:10 <vmassol> (dunno if we should upgrade now or wait for 8.0 though)  
17:11 <mflorea> would fix http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11633  
17:11 <vmassol> ok so could be interesting  
17:12 <vmassol> (if not too dangerous)
